sentence.text: Support for the Greens may have shrunk but it was still at the same level as the Liberal Democrats " , the third party in Parliament , so perhaps Ms Cooke was unduly downcast .
Catherine looked downcast , and McLeish felt uneasy .
Penelope Huntley sat silent through this speech , chain-smoking , her eyes downcast .
Leapor was still downcast about the loss of her job , perhaps unable to write much poetry , when she met Freemantle .
Which was a curious sensation , since in fact her eyes were downcast , apparently studying the vinyl squares of the floor .
Flora 's eyes were downcast too ; they usually were .
Cowed , he stiffened his stance , his eyes slightly downcast .
He looked so downcast that even Angalo patted him on the shoulder .
Harry released her and once again his expression was downcast .
A group of thirty or forty downcast men stood apart in the canter of thin ring , their heads and arms hanging slack in attitudes of despair .
But one day when the lord was off hunting the fox said : " Friends , we are all happy and contented , but our master sometimes seems rather sad and downcast .
` You must n't be downcast , " said Lydia .
I might have felt a little downcast at that point , only the evening had made me feel more encouraged about my prospects with her than I 'd felt for some time .

They gossip and joke and giggle like schoolgirls : very different from their daughters-in-law who are sometimes seen shuffling behind them , heavily veiled and silent and with the downcast eyes of prisoners under guard .
It was hot , sunny and the water looked so cool and inviting that Maggie felt quite downcast about having no swimsuit .
` It is a long time since anyone cared for you as tonight you cared for Ana , is it not ? " he asked softly , his hand coming to tilt her downcast face .
` Forgive me , Miss Kyte , " said the other lady softly , ` but you look quite downcast . "
One unnamed area was criticised after it appeared to have industrial dereliction and sad , downcast people .
